Course Description: THE STUDENT WILL LEARN TO INTERPRET AND SOLVE PROBLEMS RELATED TO THE MANAGERIAL ACCOUNTING FIELD. ADDITIONAL SUPPORT WILL BE PROVIDED TO THE STUDENT IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE THE OBJECTIVES OF ACG2071.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
COMPETENCY 1: THE STUDENT WILL APPLY AND REINFORCE THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF CASH FLOW ACTIVITIES BY:
1. PREPARING THE OPERATING, INVESTING AND FINANCIAL SECTIONS OF A CASH FLOW STATEMENT.
 
COMPETENCY 2: THE STUDENT WILL DEMONSTRATE COMPREHENSION OF CORPORATE FINANCIAL REPORTS BY:
1. ANALYZING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS TO CALCULATE VARIOUS RATIOS TO EVALUATE SOLVENCY.
2. ANALYZING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS TO CALCULATE VARIOUS RATIOS TO EVALUATE PROFITABILITY.
 
COMPETENCY 3: THE STUDENT WILL DEMONSTRATE COMPREHENSION OF COST ACCOUNTING BY:
1. DIAGRAMMING THE FLOW OF COSTS FOR A FACTORY THAT USES THE JOB ORDER SYSTEM.
2. USING A SPREADSHEET TO PREPARE A COST OF PRODUCTION REPORT FOR A PROCESS COST SYSTEM.
 
COMPETENCY 4: THE STUDENT WILL APPLY AND REINFORCE THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF BUDGETING BY:
1. CREATING PRODUCTION BUDGETS AND REPORTS USING SPREADSHEETS.
2. CREATING VARIOUS CASH BUDGETS USING SPREADSHEETS.
 
COMPETENCY 5: THE STUDENT WILL APPLY AND REINFORCE THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF COST-VOLUME-PROFIT ANALYSIS BY:
1. PERFORMING BREAK-EVEN AND TARGET PROFIT ANALYSIS.
2. PERFORMING VARIOUS WHAT-IF BUSINESS SCENARIOS USING SPREADSHEETS.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
